channel.title: Problem w/ Packages
channel.description:
Well, I have a new game that I'm making and I'm getting problems making it so that all my classes are sent to "./bin/"
my compiler is in the "." directory, my source files are in the "./src/game/" directory and my [i]cp[/i] is set to "./bin/game/" yet when I compile it says it cannot find the packages inside of the package "game" such as "game.components" and "game.utils". You get it?
When I compile without changing the class path, it compiles successfully.

item.title: Problem w/ Packages
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

freeware != free software

freeware cannot compete with pay software, because it sucks
free software can, cause its good

thats what frank meant, so dont confuse freeware with free software,

Read full topic

item.title: Problem w/ Packages
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:32, topic:213451”][quote author=pizza pie link=topic=280961.msg2286579#msg2286579 date=1213939908]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=280961.msg2286525#msg2286525 date=1213938381]

K well, the compiler is in the main directory, and then there is a folder called “src” that contains the folder “game” which contains some source files and folders called “components” and “utils”, which both have source files in them.

Now I want to compile that to the folder called “bin” which is in the same directory as “src” and the compiler. Also, “bin” contains folders called “game” and that folder has the same folders as those in the “src/game”… NO SOURCE FILES
[/quote]not compiler, BATCH FILE! Oh, and just use an IDE instead. Makes it so much cleaner and helps you A LOT with those tedious tasks such as batch files.

Hm… I just hate the stupid loading time and the ugly code…
Well, I’m referring to NetBeans… I haven’t tried anything else.
[/quote]NetBeans is shit. Use either Eclipse or IntelliJ IDEA.[/quote]
NetBeans 6.1 is quite good. I prefer it over Eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem w/ Packages
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

FUCK YOU THATONEGUY, YOU’RE INFERIOR COMPARED TO FRANK_.

When did I state I was superior to frank_? There was no trace of sarcasm in what I said about frank_.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem w/ Packages
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

But frank_ has always been infallible. And has never been defied, how is it possible that he would be corrected by a Member? It makes me wonder where this guy came from…

Leads to this answer:

It is probably just a little bit over a year ago... I joined BobDole81 together with Sw0o0sh with Geminus, back when there had been no releases like the ones today. All there was to download, mostly was a few slightly editted versions of the RSCD-server base (I am _not_ referring to RSCDaemon), along with the base itself, and some wL-eScape-based server emulators (such as my very first FreeScape version).

Which leads to me nominating him for community member.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem w/ Packages
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

pizza pie: If you tell me more exactly how your folders are placed, and in what folder you run the compilation from (and everything else I need to know about this), I can help you more… Other than that, it is very hard to help you by making my own assumptions, which might fail anyway.

Read full topic
